page.title: 13ST LAWRENCE PARISH HALL
page.content: Each of the 12 parishes in Jersey has a{Parish hall, a Parish school, a {Parish Church}and a few, like{St {Lawrence,}have{arsenals.} The Parish Hall in St. Lawrence is the centre for all sorts of activities. The chief person in the Parish is the{ {Constable.}St.Lawrence is unusual because{Mrs. Le Feuvre,}the Constable, is the{first lady}ever to be elected Constable in Jersey history. The Constable and her officers meet at the hall to investigate offences committed inside the parish borders. These are mainly driving offences. The Committee also looks after the state of the small roads and lanes and keeps them in order. The parish also looks after its needy people. The Parish Hall is also used as a{Community {Centre}for concerts,entertainments and get - togethers.
